Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2018 01:06AM - edited Jun 6, 2018 01:08AM by BinWA hi this is first time I've posted so not sure if I'm in the right place. Here I go. I'm 18 months after lumpectomy, chemo, radiation for lobular breast cancer. I was having hip pain so had CT scan and MRI. "Highly suspicious for bone mets lesion" turned up on my sacrum. I had a CT guided bone biopsy. Tests came back normal. Do you think this is reliable or could they just have missed the lesion? Thanks,
Posts.Title: If you are not Stage IV but have questions, you may post here chrissyb Olma61

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2018 12:01AM BinWA wrote: Hi dlb823, Thanks for the response, sorry it took so long for me to respond. I lost track of my initial post. Anyway, I posted about a month ago asking if you all thought that the negative results from the bone biopsy on my sacrum was reliable. Well my Docs decided they weren't reliableand called me back for second bone biopsy. I'm waiting for results again. Thanks for the support.
Posts.Title: If you are not Stage IV but have questions, you may post here chrissyb Olma61
